marketNews.title: US Dollar Index Strengthens to One-Year High
marketNews.content:
The US Dollar Index (DXY) strengthened by 2.3% week-over-week to 106.9 on Thursday 14 November, marking the highest level in the past year. This caused the Indonesian rupiah to fall to 15,889 per US dollar before closing weaker by 0.76% week-over-week at 15,855 on Thursday, the weakest level since mid-August 2024. In addition to the rupiah, several other emerging-market currencies also weakened, including the Malaysian ringgit (-1.84% WoW), Thai baht (-2.32% WoW), and Philippine peso (-0.09% WoW).

The rupiah’s depreciation and that of its peers over the past week were mainly pressured by inflationary policy discourse promoted by the newly elected US President Donald Trump. As previously reported in Stockbit Snips, Trump is advocating protectionist policies. The sentiment from Trump’s victory was reinforced by the Republican trifecta win in the 2024 US elections, where the Trump-supporting party secured majorities in both the Senate and the House of Representatives. This outcome could reduce the Democratic Party’s ability to limit Trump’s policy implementation.

Besides the Trump-related sentiment, the DXY rise was also influenced by a resurgence in US inflation. In October 2024, the US consumer price index rose 0.2% month-over-month and 2.6% year-over-year (September 2024: 0.2% MoM and 2.4% YoY), in line with consensus expectations. Core inflation in October 2024 remained at 0.3% MoM and 3.3% YoY, also matching consensus. These figures remain above the Federal Reserve’s 2% target.

The market has begun to expect a smaller rate-cut trajectory in 2025. According to the CME FedWatch Tool on Thursday 14 November, the probability of the Fed cutting rates by 75 basis points or more by June 2025 fell from 62.7% before Trump’s win to 45.9% now. Conversely, the probability of a cut of less than 75 basis points by June 2025 rose from 37.2% to 54.1%.

Alongside the rupiah’s weakness, the Indonesian capital market experienced significant foreign outflows in the past week. The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) fell 0.4% week-over-week to 7,215, with foreign outflows of 5.23 trillion rupiah over the last week as of Thursday 14 November. Government bond yields for the 10-year tenor rose 17 basis points week-over-week to 6.96% on Thursday, with foreign outflows of 5.83 trillion rupiah over the past week as of Tuesday 12 November.

Key Takeaway: Although the market is reducing optimism for large rate cuts in 2025, we assess that clearer direction of interest-rate movement still requires waiting for the magnitude and pace of implementation and potential impact of policies advocated by Trump. The strong US dollar could limit Bank Indonesia’s room to continue cutting the BI Rate.

To mitigate volatility risk from uncertain rate-cut direction, investors may lock in yields on government bonds – especially short-term series such as PBS032 – at high and attractive levels. Additionally, the SBN Retail ST013, currently in its offering period, can be an alternative as it features a floating-rate coupon with a floor.

tickerNews.title: JPFA forecasts 24% YoY increase in chicken meat demand in 2025
tickerNews.content: Senior Vice President of Japfa Comfeed Indonesia, Achmad Dawami, said that the company predicts chicken meat demand in 2025 will increase by up to 24% year-on-year, driven by the implementation of a free nutritious meals program. However, he doubts the program can achieve a chicken meat absorption target of 1.2 million tonnes per year, as stated by the expert council of the National Campaign Team of Prabowo-Gibran. According to JPFA’s projection, absorption of chicken meat in the free nutritious meals program is likely only around 900,000 tonnes per year, and Achmad mentioned that an absorption of 400,000 tonnes already has a good impact for the company.

tickerNews.title: SKRN announces interim dividend 320.3 billion IDR for FY2024
tickerNews.content: Superkrane Mitra Utama announced an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to 320.3 billion rupiah, or 45 rupiah per share. The cum-date in the regular market and negotiations is 22 November 2024, with payment on 6 December 2024. Based on SKRN’s closing price on Thursday (14 November) at 466 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is 9.7%.

tickerNews.title: BUMI to conduct private placement of 1.4 million new shares
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources announced it will conduct a private placement of 1.4 million new shares at a price of 157 rupiah per share as part of the execution of a mandatory convertible bond. The corporate action will take place on 21 November 2024.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea insiders buy PTRO shares, increasing holdings
tickerNews.content: Petrosea Commissioner Erwin Ciputra purchased 174,000 PTRO shares at an average price of 18,363 rupiah per share on 8 and 11 November 2024, total transaction value about 3.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Ciputra’s ownership rose from 0.045% to 0.062%. In a separate transaction, PTRO Director Kartika Hendrawan bought 80,000 PTRO shares at an average price of 19,445 rupiah per share on 11 and 12 November 2024, total value about 1.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Hendrawan’s ownership increased from 0.0088% to 0.0167%.

tickerNews.title: ISAT and GoTo launch Indonesian-language LLM Sahabat-AI
tickerNews.content: Indosat, together with GoTo (Gojek Tokopedia), launched a large language model (LLM) ecosystem named Sahabat-AI, specifically designed for the Indonesian language. ISAT and GoTo said that Sahabat-AI enables developers to create AI-based applications and services in Indonesian as well as various regional languages. The open-source LLM is supported by AI Singapore and Tech Mahindra of India, and uses Nvidia’s AI Enterprise software, including Nvidia NeMo, to train the model and improve its overall language understanding.

tickerNews.title: TOBA expects coal reserve depletion by 2025-2027 and shifts to renewable projects
tickerNews.content: TBS Energi Utama Director Juli Oktarina said that coal reserves from the company's various mining concessions will be exhausted around 2025-2027, although mining contract permits remain relatively long. Juli also stated that TOBA does not plan to apply for contract extensions to extract additional coal resources, and confirms that the company does not intend to acquire other coal mines. Nevertheless, Juli mentioned that TOBA has anticipated potential revenue decline from the coal segment by acquiring several waste-management projects and investing in new renewable energy (EBT) projects.

tickerNews.title: ITMG reports 9.4% YoY increase in 3Q24 coal production
tickerNews.content: Indo Tambangraya Megah reported coal production volume of 5.8 million tonnes in 3Q24, a 9.4% year-on-year increase and 34.9% quarter-on-quarter increase, bringing 9-month production to 15 million tonnes, up 11.1% YoY. Coal sales volume in 3Q24 grew to 6.3 million tonnes, up 18.9% YoY and 8.6% QoQ, resulting in 9-month sales of 17.1 million tonnes, up 12.5% YoY.

tickerNews.title: ANTM plans 2024 dividend with 35-40% payout ratio
tickerNews.content: Aneka Tambang Director Arianto Sabtonugroho Rudjito said the company plans to distribute a 2024 fiscal year dividend with a payout ratio around 35-40%, lower than the 2023 payout ratio of 100%. Arianto explained that the lower payout ratio considers funding needs for several upcoming corporate projects. In 2024, ANTM has launched several expansions, such as the launch of a smelter-grade alumina refinery (SGAR) in Mempawah and the acquisition of a 30% stake in the nickel affiliate of Eternal Tsingshan Group, PT Jiu Long Metal Industry.

tickerNews.title: BBTN to partner with BBRI on 3-million-unit housing program
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) President Nixon L. P. Napitupulu said the bank will cooperate with Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) to implement a program providing 3 million housing units per year, as advocated by President Prabowo Subianto. Nixon noted the collaboration leverages BBRI’s extensive network across Indonesia. The financing split between BBTN and BBRI has not yet been decided and will await ministerial approval. He also explained that the 3-million-unit program will not rely solely on mortgage (KPR) schemes; part of the units will be delivered as assistance.

tickerNews.title: DRMA discusses potential cooperation with BYD and other Chinese OEMs
tickerNews.content: Dharma Polimetal (DRMA) Director Yosaphat Simanjuntak said the company has established communication with BYD regarding possible cooperation to supply automotive components. He could not disclose further details. DRMA President Irianto Santoso also said the company is working with a Chinese vehicle manufacturer, without specifying the identity. To date, DRMA has supplied automotive components to manufacturers such as Hyundai, Kia, Toyota, and to two-wheelers like PT Astra Honda Motor (AHM).

tickerNews.title: DATA sells 28.3 million shares, ownership falls to 78.3%
tickerNews.content: Remala Abadi (DATA) controller Verah Wahyudi Singgih Wong sold 28.3 million DATA shares at an average price of 552 rupiah per share between 7 and 12 November 2024, total transaction value about 15.6 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Verah’s ownership decreased from 80.4% to 78.3%.

tickerNews.title: NSSS shareholder PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama sells 44 million shares
tickerNews.content: Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera (NSSS) shareholder PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama sold 44 million NSSS shares at an average price of 206 rupiah per share on 8 November 2024, total transaction value about 9 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama’s ownership fell from 27% to 26.81%.

tickerNews.title: RAJA director Ogi Rulino buys 1.75 million shares
tickerNews.content: Rukun Raharja (RAJA) Director Ogi Rulino bought 1.75 million RAJA shares at 1,355 rupiah per share on 8 November 2024, total transaction value about 2.4 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Ogi Rulino’s ownership increased from 0% to 0.04%.
